original_dialogue:
A: I think modern painting means nothing .
B: I think so too . It's just pointless .
A: Then why are so many crazy about it
B: I don't know.Maybe they are really crazy .
A: Maybe .

preferences.reasoning: User expresses a negative view on modern painting, suggesting it lacks meaning and is perceived as pointless. This indicates a dislike for modern painting as an art form.
User questions why many people seem to be enthusiastic about modern painting despite their own negative view, indicating a strong desire to understand this phenomenon and the motivations of others.
preferences.target_label: interest in why people like modern painting
preferences.original_mention: Then why are so many crazy about it

original_dialogue:
A: I feel like going for a drink , it's been a long day .
B: Great idea ! Peter , I could use the drink .
A: How about the new bar across road ?
B: Sounds good . The food there is fantastic , too .
A: I agree , I had lunch there last week .
B: excellent ! That sounds like a plan .

preferences.reasoning: User expresses a desire to go to a bar, suggesting they find the idea appealing after a long day.

original_dialogue:
A: What are you thinking ?
B: I ’ m thinking about where we shall spend our vocation .
A: It ’ s about 7 o ’ clock . let ’ s have our breakfast first .
B: Ok , dear.We will be late .
A: What do you want ?
B: A ham salad sandwich .
A: Sorry , I didn ’ t prepare this .
B: Then , I ’ d like some eggs and bread for breakfast instead .
A: Ok , I ’ ll have it sent to you immediately .

preferences.reasoning: User expresses a clear preference for a specific type of breakfast, indicating a liking for eggs and bread over other options when ham salad sandwich is unavailable.

original_dialogue:
A: Can I take your order please ?
B: Can I get a burger and a large fries ?
A: Sure . Anything to drink with that ?
B: A large coke , please .
A: Eating here or to go ?
B: Eating here , please .
A: That's 7 dollars and 25 cents . You can get free refills with your coke .

preferences.reasoning: User clearly expresses a preference for eating here rather than taking the food to go, indicating a comfort or desire to consume the meal on-site.

original_dialogue:
A: Oh ! My mouth is on fire !
B: I feel so good . That warm hot pot certainly hits the spot on winter nights .
A: I need more water !
B: Oooo ... gross ... you're sweating all over the place .
A: It's your fault for mixing the two broths !
B: You're going to have a little Montezuma's revenge tomorrow morning .

preferences.reasoning: User expresses discomfort due to the spiciness of the food, indicating a lack of enjoyment of the burning sensation in their mouth.
User expresses a need for water to alleviate the discomfort caused by the spiciness, indicating a functional need for hydration.

original_dialogue:
A: Hey Joanne . What are you up to ?
B: I'm just watching some television .
A: I'm so bored . I don't know what I'm going to do today and it is only ten in the morning .
B: Me too . Do you think we are boring people ?
A: I don't think we are boring . It's just that we don't have any hobbies .
B: That's right . What do you think we should do as a hobby ?
A: That all depends on what you like to do . For example , I like to doodle on the notepad , so I'm thinking about doing some real drawings .
B: I like to play the piano for fun .
A: Yeah . That can be a good hobby .
B: Hobbies are great . I'm going to make a list of all the things I like to do .
A: That's a great idea . I'm going to do the same .

preferences.reasoning: The user expresses an interest in taking up drawing as a hobby, which indicates a fondness for artistic activities and a desire to engage in creative expression.
The user indicates that they plan to make a list of hobbies, implying a desire to actively seek out and engage in enjoyable activities, showcasing a goal-oriented approach to finding hobbies.
preferences.original_mention: make a list of all the things I like to do

original_dialogue:
A: How is your house hunting going ?
B: Not very well . I haven ’ t found anything within my price range yet .
A: How much are you looking to spend ?
B: I can only afford about 300 pounds a month .
A: Looks like you ’ re not going to get more than a bedroom in a shared flat with that .
B: Really ? That ’ s a lot of money to pay for one room .
A: Well , if you want to live in London , you have to pay the price !
B: Do you know of anyone who needs a roommate ?
A: I can ask around at work . Do you have a preference for makers or non-smokers ?
B: I ’ d prefer non-smoking roommates , but I guess I ’ ll have to take what I can get !
A: How long do you want to sign a contract for ?
B: I can sign a contract up to a year . I don ’ t know where I ’ ll be after that .
A: Do you need a furnished or unfurnished apartment ?
B: I don ’ t have any furniture , so it ’ d be great if it were furnished .
A: You know that you ’ ll have to pay utilities on top of the rent , right ?
B: No , I thought that would be included in the rent .
A: It ’ s not usually included , so you ’ ll have to factor in about 100 pounds more each month for utilities .
B: I don't think I can afford that .
A: Don ’ t worry . Sometimes people will give you a discount if you promise to do the cleaning or take care of the children .
B: That ’ s a good idea . I ’ ll look into finding something like that .

preferences.reasoning: User indicates a preference for non-smoking roommates, suggesting a concern for air quality or lifestyle compatibility.
User expresses a specific need for furniture as they do not own any, highlighting a necessity for a furnished apartment.

original_dialogue:
A: Hi , Kenji .
B: Hi , Debbie . Have a seat . How's it going ?
A: I'm OK . How are you doing ?
B: Pretty good . Listen ... have you heard about the new Thai restaurant over on University Avenue ?
A: Do you mean The Bangkok ?
B: That's the one . A bunch of us are going there for dinner tomorrow night.How about coming with us ?
A: Sure , I'd love to .
B: Great . I'll call and make reservations .
A: Any time after 6 o'clock is good for me.Oh ! I'm late ! I have a class .
B: All right . I'll call you tonight and tell you the time .
A: Great . Talk to you then .

preferences.reasoning: User expresses desire to go to the new Thai restaurant with friends, indicating enthusiasm for socializing and trying new food.
preferences.original_mention: the new Thai restaurant over on University Avenue

preferences.reasoning: User responds positively and expresses eagerness to join the group for dinner, showing a strong preference for engaging in social activities with others.
preferences.original_mention: a bunch of us are going there for dinner tomorrow night. How about coming with us?

original_dialogue:
A: What can I do for you ?
B: I want my hair cut .
A: How would you like your hair cut ?
B: I'm not sure . What do you suggest ?
A: Well , how about like this ?
B: I don't like it . It's outdated .
A: Okay . How about this style ?
B: It seems a little too wild .
A: Can you give me some idea of what you'd like ?
B: I want a haircut just like that kind .
A: OK , I see .

preferences.reasoning: User expresses a dislike for a particular outdated style, indicating they don't appreciate that type of haircut.
User wants a haircut that resembles a specific style suggested by the other speaker, showing a desire to achieve a desired look.
preferences.original_mention: I want a haircut just like that kind.

original_dialogue:
A: I think I'm going to China this vacation.How about you ?
B: Me ? I prefer France .
A: I went to France last summer .
B: Oh , really ? I went to China last winter !

preferences.reasoning: User expresses a clear preference for France when asked about vacation choices, indicating a liking for that destination.

original_dialogue:
A: John , do you mind helping me prepare for the picnic ?
B: Sure . Have you checked the weather report ?
A: Yes . It says it will be sunny all day . No sign of rain at all .
B: I'd like some toast and chicken wings .
A: Okay . Please take some fruit salad and crackers for me .
B: Done . Oh , don't forget to take napkins , disposable plates , cups and picnic blanket .
A: That's great . We can also take the dragon kite with us . After the picnic , we can fly it .
B: Cool , we can take shuttlecock and badminton racket .
A: Okay , it sounds good .

preferences.reasoning: User shows enthusiasm and excitement about going to a picnic by suggesting fun activities like flying a dragon kite, indicating a positive feeling about this idea.

User expresses agreement with the suggestions made about picnic items and activities, suggesting that they like the idea of taking those items and doing those activities, which reflects a positive sentiment toward the overall picnic preparation.

original_dialogue:
A: Wow , you ’ re up early today ! What ’ s for breakfast ?
B: Well , I felt like baking , so I made some muffins .
A: Smells good ! I ’ ll make some coffee . Do you want me to make you some eggs ?
B: Sure , I'll take mine , sunny side up .
A: Www , I don ’ t know how you can eat your eggs like that ! Ever since I was small , I ’ Ve had eggs and soldiers .
B: You know , my dad had scrambled eggs every morning for twenty years . It drove my mom crazy !
A: You know what really drives me crazy ? When I ask for soft boiled eggs , and they overcook them , so they come out hard boiled ! How can you dipyour toast into a hard boiled egg ?
B: You ’ re so picky sometimes .
A: Here you go , honey , fried eggs .
B: Dammit ! I asked for sunny side up ! How many times do I have to tell you .

preferences.reasoning: User has a strong emotional reaction when the eggs are not prepared to their liking. They feel frustrated to the point of using an expletive, indicating a strong desire for the specific way they prefer their eggs, which is sunny side up.

original_dialogue:
A: How do you like the food here ?
B: I don't like it very much.But every-body likes their own food best .
A: There are many things I miss . You can't get the ingredients here .
B: Are you sure ? All the big cities have specialty shops , which sell all sorts of ethnic foods .
A: Perhaps . i just haven't had time to find them yet .

preferences.reasoning: User expresses a lack of enjoyment for the food available, indicating a negative sentiment towards the experience of eating food at this location.
preferences.original_mention: I don't like it very much

preferences.reasoning: Despite disliking the food, user acknowledges that everyone has their own preferences, suggesting a personal understanding of diverse tastes and an interest in the topic of food variety.
preferences.original_mention: every-body likes their own food best

original_dialogue:
A: Let's go to Wangfujing by bus .
B: Better take the subway . It's faster , and more convenient .
A: OK , it will be a new experience for me .
B: We have a rather comprehensive subway system here . You can get almost anywhere rather quickly on a subway , especially at this time of day when the traffic is heavy .
A: Where do we pay the fare ?
B: Just give the man standing there 3 yuan and he'll give you a token . Then , you slip it into the slot at the turnstile and push the turnstile to get in .
A: Let me pay for it . Where can I get a subway map ?
B: Ask the worker who sells tokens to give you one . It's free fo charge . Actually maps showing subway routes are posted at most stations .
A: Do I have to pay an additional fare to change trains ?
B: No , you don't have to . Here comes the train .

preferences.reasoning: User shows a willingness to try the subway system as indicated by their response 'OK, it will be a new experience for me.' This suggests they are open to new experiences and likely view this as positive.

User's question about paying the fare indicates a need for clarity and understanding of the process involved in using the subway. This highlights a necessary functional need in navigating public transportation.
preferences.original_mention: Where do we pay the fare?

preferences.reasoning: User's inquiry about 'getting a subway map' shows an interest in furthering their knowledge about the subway system, indicating a desire to be prepared and informed during the experience.
preferences.original_mention: Where can I get a subway map?

preferences.reasoning: User's intention to 'pay for it' signifies a proactive attitude towards participating in the subway journey, which reflects positively on their engagement with the new experience.

original_dialogue:
A: Look , there's no way we can convince people they need fresh motor oil every morning .
B: No , but you can let them know that yours is the cream of the crop-the purest motor oil in the world . Careful , hold it by the java jacket . This coffee drink has half and half-what do you think ?
A: It tastes funny . Why can't people just stick to plain and simple coffee ?
B: That's just the point ! Purity is the essence of good coffee , right ?

preferences.reasoning: User prefers plain coffee over flavored or complex varieties. This suggests a dislike for additives or enhancements, which is a strong indication of their preference for simplicity.

original_dialogue:

B: I'd like to see some coats . Would you recommend me some of them ?
A: Sure . Come to look at these styles . They sell very well .
B: Which models do you sell the most ?
A: How about these ? They are the current bestsellers .
B: I like this style , but I don't like its color . Do you have this coat in yellow ?
A: Yes , I will find one for you . Here you are . It's made of exceptionally good quality , pure wool , and is very soft .
B: It looks nice .
A: Yeah , this is the latest model.If you like it , you can try it on .

preferences.original_mention: Do you have this coat in yellow ?

original_dialogue:
A: Out of every movie that you've seen , which one is your favorite ?
B: I'm going to have to say that Superbad is the best movie ever .
A: You think so , how come ?
B: Well , Superbad is super funny .
A: You're not lying , I found that movie absolutely hilarious .
B: I didn't know that you saw Superbad before .
A: I made sure to be in line to see it the first day it came out .
B: I couldn't keep from laughing throughout the whole movie .
A: I was laughing hysterically the whole time ; my stomach muscles hurt afterwards .
B: That's exactly how I felt .
A: I got the movie when it came out on DVD , do you want to come over ?
B: I would love to .

preferences.reasoning: User expresses a level of enthusiasm about seeing the movie 'Superbad' the first day it came out, reflecting a strong positive sentiment towards the movie itself.
preferences.original_mention: Superbad is the best movie ever

preferences.reasoning: User mentions laughing hysterically the whole time during the movie, which indicates a high level of enjoyment and amusement, showing a strong emotional response to the movie.
preferences.original_mention: I was laughing hysterically the whole time

preferences.reasoning: User demonstrated eagerness to share and enjoy the movie with the other speaker, indicating a desire for social interaction based around their shared experience of the movie.
preferences.original_mention: do you want to come over?

original_dialogue:
A: May I help you , sir ?
B: I'd like to buy a shirt .
A: What color do you want ?
B: I prefer the blue one .
A: What size are you ?
B: I'm not sure . Could you measure me , please ?
A: No problem . I think 40 will be fine for you .
B: Can I try it on ?
A: Of course . The fitting room is this way , please .

preferences.reasoning: User expresses a favoring toward a specific color, which indicates a liking for it.
User expresses the desire to try the shirt on, which indicates an interest in confirming the fit before purchase.

original_dialogue:
A: What do you think of this flat ?
B: It's not really all that good . The bedroom is a little small for us .
A: Small , but it should be enough for our needs . I think .
B: But there's no hot water after 10 at night . Sometimes I like to have a hot shower before bed . especially in the winter . It feels good .
A: That's true . But I love the living room ; it's huge and filled with sunshine .
B: True , and I like the kitchen . It's new and well equipped .
A: It has a great balcony with an incredible view of the park .
B: You're right . The view is spectacular . But that bedroom is so small . We'd never be able to fit all of our stuff in there .
A: Maybe we could get some new furniture . Better stuff .
B: I haven't thought of that .

preferences.reasoning: User expresses a fondness for the ability to take a hot shower before bed, particularly in winter, indicating a preference for warmth and comfort.
preferences.original_mention: no hot water after 10 at night

preferences.reasoning: User appreciates the kitchen's state of being new and well equipped, showing a positive sentiment towards its features which implies liking for functionality and quality.
User acknowledges the spectacular view, which suggests they value beautiful aspects of a living space, indicating a preference for inspiring surroundings.

original_dialogue:
A: Do you like Barry ?
B: No , not very much . He ’ s too ambitious and dishonest .
A: I agree . I like his brother , Paul . They are not alike .
B: Yes . They are completely different . Paul is very sociable and much more honest than his brother .
A: What kind of person do you consider yourself to be ?
B: I think I ’ m polite , careful , relaxed and shy .
A: Oh , I don ’ t think you ’ re shy ! You are always chatting with new people when we go to a party .
B: Well , yes , but those people always start talking to me . I never talk to them first . Perhaps I ’ m not as shy as I think . Anyway , you ’ re certainly not shy !
A: You ’ re right . I love going out and making new friends .
B: So , you ’ ll be at my birthday party on Friday ?
A: Of course !

preferences.reasoning: User expresses a dislike for Barry due to his negative traits of ambition and dishonesty. This reflects a clear negative sentiment towards the character.
preferences.original_mention: No, not very much. He’s too ambitious and dishonest.

preferences.reasoning: User prefers Paul's characteristics over Barry's, indicating admiration for sociability and honesty. This reflects a positive preference towards Paul as a person.
preferences.original_mention: I like his brother, Paul. They are not alike.

original_dialogue:
A: What's the best way downtown ?
B: Let me see . It depends .
A: Depends ? Depends on what ?
B: If you are in a hurry , you should take a taxi .
A: Is that expensive ?
B: Yes , very . Believe it or not , it will cost you more than one hundred dollars .
A: I am in no particular hurry .
B: Take a bus then . It will only cost you 5 dollars .
A: That's not so bad .

preferences.reasoning: User evaluates the cost of taking a bus as being reasonable compared to the taxi fare they mentioned earlier.

original_dialogue:
A: That's great ! We made 20 minutes earlier .
B: Good thing , we took a taxi .
A: Mom , you are the best !
B: Hey , look there . It is an advertisement of the piano training class on the billboard . The place is not far from our home .
A: Mom , come on . What are you thinking about ?
B: Your sister is in high school now ; no one plays the piano at home .
A: Don't tell me you want me to do that ?
B: Why ? Why not ! The piano is right there .
A: But I don't like playing the piano . And the homework keeps me busy enough .
B: Anyway , I will have a look at the piano class after work by myself .
A: How depressed !

preferences.reasoning: User A expresses a disinterest and negative feeling towards piano playing, indicating a lack of enjoyment or liking for it.
preferences.original_mention: I don't like playing the piano

preferences.reasoning: User A feels overwhelmed by homework, indicating a pressing need that may affect their engagement with other activities.
preferences.original_mention: the homework keeps me busy enough

original_dialogue:
A: Do you like this dress , madam ?
B: I like the colour very much . It's a lovely dress , but it's too small for me .
A: What about this one ? It's a lovely dress . It's very smart . Short skirts are in fashion now . Would you like to try it ?
B: All right . I'm afraid this green dress is too small for me as well . It's smaller than the blue one . I don't like the colour either . It doesn't suit me at all . I think the blue dress is prettier . Co
A: I'm afraid I haven't got a larger dress . This is the largest dress in the shop .

original_dialogue:
A: What shall we do after the volleyball match ?
B: How about going to the Olympic souvenir store to have a look ? I remember there is one in the gym .
A: That's a good idea . I was thinking of buying some gifts for my family .
B: Me , too . What did you have in mind ?
A: I haven't decided yet , but I think the Olympic Mascots are a must .
B: I agree . They're very lovely , especially Huanhuan
A: Is that the red one ? That is my favorite , too . Do you know how much they are ?
B: The five dolls are sold together as a set , and they're priced according to the size . The bigger they are the more expensive .
A: Oh , I see . If I buy more than a set , can I get any discount ?
B: I don't think so . All the souvenirs of the Olympic Games are very hot right now .
A: Any other ideas ?
B: There are lots of things , such as postcards , key chains , posters and various arts and crafts .
A: It all sounds great . We can go there after the match . I can't wait to see what they have .

preferences.reasoning: User expresses excitement and anticipation about going to the store and seeing the various souvenirs, indicating a positive emotional response toward the experience.
User indicates a desire to purchase specific items, like the Olympic mascots, showing a personal interest in those products.

original_dialogue:
A: Good evening , ma'am . Table for one ?
B: Yes , please .
A: Will this table be all right ?
B: Actually , I'd like a booth by the window if that's possible .
A: Certainly . How about this one ?
B: This will be fine , thanks .
A: ( Handing her a menu ) Your waiter will be here in a minute to take your order .
B: Thank you .

preferences.reasoning: The user expresses a desire to sit in a specific type of seating arrangement that they prefer, indicating a strong liking for booths, especially by the window.
The user shows satisfaction with the alternative provided by the staff, which suggests a positive outcome was achieved even if it was not the original preference.

original_dialogue:

A: Wait a few minutes and I'll go there with you .
B: Let's get a shopping cart .

B: What are you going to buy ?
A: Let's check out the fruit section first .
B: OK . I'd like some oranges . But they don't look quite ripe yet .
A: Look , nice fresh cherries ! They are ripe and soft . I'll take some .
B: I'll take some , too .
A: Let's go to the snacks section . I want some chocolate and sweets .
B: OK . I'll go and buy some cakes .
A: Do you want to buy something else ?
B: No . Let's go over to the check-out stand .

The user expresses a clear intention to buy cakes, indicating a strong desire for them as they agree to go buy them immediately following the mention.

original_dialogue:
A: So , tell me about you new house . How is it different to your old one ?
B: Well , first of all , it ’ s much bigger . It has the same number of rooms , but each room is larger . We also have a larger garden , which our dog loves , of course !
A: So , it ’ s a three-bedrooms detached house ?
B: Yes . One bedroom is for my wife and I . there ’ s another for our daughter . My wife wants to use the third one as a guest room , but I ’ d like to make it into a study . Our daughter is also keen on making it a study , so that ’ s probably what will happen .
A: What ’ s the kitchen like ? I know both you and your wife like to cook .
B: That ’ s one of the main reason we chose that particular house . The kitchen and dining room are together . It ’ s really large .
A: Are the rooms nice and bright ?
B: Yes , they are . That ’ s very important to us . We like to live in a home with plenty of natural light . Each room has large windows .
A: Do you have a balcony ?
B: No , we don ’ t . We wish weがあったのに . That ’ s the only thing we wanted , but don ’ t have . The area is very nice and the neighbours seem friendly .
A: You ’ re right on the edge of the city , aren ’ t you ? There can ’ t be much noise or traffic there . Is it easy to get into city centre ?
B: It ’ s a very quiet neighbourhood . There ’ s some traffic , but not much . It ’ s not very difficult to get to the city centre , but you must remember to turn left and right at the right places or you ’ ll get lost . So when are you going to drop by ?

preferences.reasoning: The speaker expresses a strong preference for living in a home with abundant natural light, which is deemed very important to them.
The speaker expresses a desire for a balcony, indicating that it was a wanted feature for their new house that they unfortunately do not have.
preferences.original_mention: we wish we had a balcony

User's intention to buy the sunglasses indicates they want to obtain this specific item, showing a strong desire or goal to complete the purchase after the positive experience of trying them.

original_dialogue:
A: OK , Ann , you spent quite a bit of time in Australia recently so why don't you talk about that ?
B: I really liked living in Australia . I was an international student and I studied education at the university of Sydney . And living in Sydney was fantasticbecuase I could go to the beach anytime I wanted and there was a great nightlife in Sydney . There are lots of great clubs . And people were very , very friendly and easy-going and I met a lot of international people in living Sydney .
A: Mm-hm . How long were you there ?
B: I was there for almost a year .
A: Oh , OK .
B: And I travelled a little bit in Australia . I went up the east coast . Up to Frasier Island . Which is a world heritage site . And I saw dingo running along the beach and sharks in the water . We climbed cliffs and went through a rain forest and went camping and then we went up to the ... , which is a but north . And the further north you go in Australia , the hotter it gets . So we were able to go swimming in the ocean and I went diving for the first time but it was a little bit risky cause I didn't have a diving license , so I went on an introductory dive and I saw a giant clam that had a really purple spongy inside that I was able to touch and then the clam closed up really quickly .
A: So , did you , did you lose your finger ?
B: Almost .
A: Almost . Ah , you're lucky . Um , it's funny , you go in the water and you worry about sharks , but not clams .
B: Exactly .
A: Will you be going back to Australia soon ?
B: I'd like to go and live there for at least another year . Probably I'll go back to Sydney or maybe I'll go down to Melbourne because it's a really interesting cultural city . They have lot of museums and parks .

preferences.reasoning: The speaker expresses a desire to return to Australia and live there for a longer period, indicating a strong preference for continuing their experience in that location.
preferences.original_mention: I'd like to go and live there for at least another year.

preferences.reasoning: The speaker's reference to wanting to live in Sydney or possibly move to Melbourne shows a particular liking for these locations, especially highlighting Melbourne as a culturally interesting city.
preferences.original_mention: maybe I'll go down to Melbourne because it's a really interesting cultural city.
